metadata.Title: CVE-2022-26125 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Buffer overflow vulnerabilities exist in FRRouting through 8.1.0 due to wrong checks on the input packet length in isisd/isis_tlvs.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26125` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1').
